description:
****Highly Recommend, Does Not Get More Authentic Than El Porteño!**** 
Service was great, food was authentic, not overwhelmed with spices, but just right. 

As someone who is a very picky eater, and will not eat something if I don't like it, I have to say I was highly impressed with El Porteño. 

I've been to the best restaurants in Peru by famous chefs which really don't impress me. I go to the better ones, where recipes have been handed down from generation to generation, & are made with a little TLC. Those are the places that I would take my friends that visit Lima with me, & that's exactly what I found today at El Porteño!

So today I finally made the trek to give El Porteño a world. I ordered three of my favorite chifa dishes. 

First up, Camlu Wonton... food came out in about 10 mins, nice and hot. We went in for the first bite wontons were not over saturated with sauce, and crunchy. Veggies, although in sauce, still had some crunch to them which is how I like it. The pork perfect, the chicken also just right, and the shrimp on point. 9/10 (only because I'm used to bigger slices of pork, and chicken). 
Next up Pork arroz chaufa, not greasy and full of flavor. Wasn't overwhelmed with soy sauce, but one of those times where something just happens to be exactly as it should be. 10/10. 
Last but definitely not least the Chijaukay. Just enough soy sauce, sesame oil, scallions and crunch on the chicken. Once again 10/10. 

What's left? DESERT!!
We said well we are 3 for 3 tonight, if they mess this up, I'm ok since the main course was damn near perfect!

Picarones!! We were advised it would take a little longer, since they cook it apart from main course dishes in order to maintain that distinct flavor Picarones have. Maybe 14 mins later, which gave us some time to digest our dinner, they came out pippin hot with authentic miel. Not too thick where the center doesn't cook and is still doughy, and not too thin where they get overcooked quickly, damnit they were perfect! 

I am happy to say that we have found our new Peruvian spot that's worth the 45min drive. And maybe not just for Chifa, maybe for everything. Can't wait to visit again. 

Compliments to the chef, & Kimberly for her attention to detail when it comes to customer service. Thank you for a wonderful dinner experience. 

Yes, parking is a pain to find, but when you do, the wait will be worth it! Can't blame the business for that. I rate the food and the service, not the color of the building across the street or the double parked car on the corner.
author: Jae B.

description:
Place was okay , it's a small restaurant,  customer service was okay too , not outstanding .
Food proportion was great, presentation good but not authentic Peruvian for me at all!!
For a non Peruvian person , I guess they would find it great food for them but for me , not tasteful at all.
author: Ruby H.

description:
I've only picked up from here for take out.

The lomo saltado is pretty damn good and it's A LOT of food. I usually eat twice from one order.

I took a friend here who is also a fan of lomo saltado & he was super into it as well.

Last time I went, it ran me like $16ish total. Not bad if you eat from it twice!
author: Sandra N.

description: We absolutely LOVE this spot. We come here at least once a week. The food is yummy. Very friendly staff and the owner is a sweet heart. My kids love coming her as well.
author: Roxy Z.

description: Ok I feel complete now been to 7 Peruvian restaurants and I must say I found the winner of authentic like at home food place is great waitresses are great prompt got food in a great time there checha is a 10 there food is too die for and to top it offf the Peruvian donuts are fire you must try I recommend this place to the fullest ty
author: Johnny V.

description: Excellent food and service. I had saltado de pollo and my bf had tallarín verde. Both dishes were amazing! We are for sure coming back.
author: Grace C.

description:
This place is actually one of my favorite places to get Peruvian food in SF. Their food is so delicious, it is reasonably priced, and the servers are very friendly. 

The appetizer we ordered were the anticuchos. They give you about 3-4 pieces of beef heart on a skewer with some deliciously crispy and soft potatoes and a sauce that has a little kick to it. It is my favorite appetizer at any Peruvian restaurant and they make it so well here. The beef heart is not too chewy or tough at all. 

Whenever I come here, I always order the Tallarin Saltado with beef or chicken. It's just a noodle version of Lomo Saltado and let me tell you, the sauce just makes it that much better. 

We also order food to go, which is when I order the Lomo Saltado. It's definitely my favorite Peruvian dish. I really like the way they make it here. This restaurant is just good authentic Peruvian food. 

Please give this place a shot!
author: Allyson L.

description: This was my first time trying Peruvian food and it was SO unbelievably delicious! I had the seafood paella and I was very impressed. There was so much flavor and everything was cooked perfectly. The wait staff were so polite and helpful. They answered all my questions and the service overall was good. Everything including the decor felt very authentic. Love it, would definitely come back!
author: Aly A.

description:
Food here is authentic. Just like back home. 
Some complain about the service. But you don't come here for that, you come to this restaurant for good food.
author: Gustavo B.

description: Excellent Peruvian food. Basic decor and set up. I recommend the Lomo Saltado.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Victor provided awesome service with amazing recommendations. Awesome family restaurant with delicious dishes. 

Second time back here and once again ordered lomo Saltado and tried the tallarin de pollo which was flavorful and hearty. 

Will definitely be back with some friends and family. Definitely prefer this authentic Peruvian spot over Fresca!
author: Brianne I.

description: Authentic Peruvian food! Cheerful service, reasonable prices, and rustic atmosphere. Try the Jalea with an ice cold Cusqueña. You won't be disappointed.
author: Cklam A.

description: Very authentic family owned and operated place. Love the seafood risotto. Service is quick and everything is reasonably priced.
author: Benjamin D.

description:
Had lunch there today Sunday. Very friendly fast service, this is a busy restaurant with lots of locals. Food was excellent with very large servings. Lots of seafood offerings. We don't come this way very often (we were at the Crocker Amazon fields), but we would be happy to eat here again.

The only difficulty was parking. We found street parking on Mount Vernon Ave.
author: MJ L.

description:
This place used to be good.. but now, it kinda sucks =(
We are 100% Peruvian, and know the difference between good and terrible Peruvian food. The waitstaff are nice, but they can only do so much with the quality of food they're working with. Whoever makes drinks needs new training for sure: avoid getting pisco sours here - you've been warned.
The only saving grace is the causa de camarones. Absolutely the only dish that didn't disappoint us all the way. The ceviche is not bad either, but one can definitely find better in the mission.
We won't be visiting again, unless they hire new cooks that is.. well.. maybe.
author: Miss E.

description:
My boyfriend's friends wanted to get Peruvian food and the first thought that went through my head when my boyfriend told me that was, "Uh, What's that?" Uh, bomb ass food, that's what it is. 

Located on Mission St., parking could be kind of tough depending on when you come here. My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on a Thursday night I think and we lucky to have found parking at the next block over. And since it was after 6pm, we didn't have to feed the meter.

The inside of this place doesn't look like much, but trust me- it's good. The lady working that night was super friendly and patient with us as we took our time with the menu and even switched out our empty water jugs when it ran out. That's service. And she was the only one working that night servicing (from what I could see) so props to her for working so quick. Their menu actually has a good amount of options if you're not sure what you're craving exactly. They even have fried rice on the menu which is insane and I'll probably go for it next time I'm here just to try it out. What I did end up ordering from here was their seafood pesto pasta and holy shit, it was bomb. Their pesto sauce is definitely homemade and fresh. Like you can just taste it in each bite. What a difference from my usual pesto sauce from Costco, lol.

Prices are somewhat high, but I get that it's the area you're in and I'm down to come back and splurge a little again when I can.
author: Venus L.

description:
Came here for dinner with my best friend. Last minute on a Sunday because 7 Mile House was closed so I looked through my Yelp and I had this place bookmarked and it was close to where we were. 

Street parking around on Geneva. Large restaurant but only ever 10% full the entire time I was there but steady stream of people coming in at least. The menu is half Peruvian and other half Chinese. Looking at the photos no one is ordering the Chinese food here. 

Got the Ceviche appetizer and the Paella entree to share. Plenty of food for the both of us. Left stuffed with leftovers. I love the decor and its a super clean and well lit restaurant. Can't believe all these reviews about the poor service here. Our waitress was SO nice an when my friend was asking about their house made beverages, she brought my friend samples! Cute! We also got the flan to share for dessert. 

Three stars because for the price, I would rather go to Limon. Literally the same prices and the location of this place cannot justify the prices they're charging. This has to be one of the most highest priced places in the Excelsior.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Dining solo. Had: Lomo Salatado - Beef tenderloin slices, sautéed with onions, tomatoes and spices, served with French fries and rice. (restaurants description)

French fries were sautéed w/ the other veggies and beef which meant they were limp not crispy. Must be what French fries in Peru are all about. The dish was tasty. The beef was NOT tenderloin slices, at best it was skirt steak, a little TOUGH. All is in the context of a very tasty dish. The white rice had an undeterminable herb aroma, delicate and delicious with the Lomo Salatado. 

Service was friendly.
author: Matsuo U.

description:
$100 for 2 people ? For mayo covered salad and deep fried chicken bones ???

Service is super sweet and accommodating. I have 0 complains about that
author: Masha M.

description:
I have travelled to Peru a bunch of times so I have been able to taste this type of food a million times. I spent a week in Arequipa in 1992 and since that year I had to come back to Peru at least 15 or 20 times. My experience traveling across this country has allowed me to visit the most popular restaurants in Lima, Cusco, Ayacucho, Nazca, etc. I found the food at El Porteño bland and boring. I had the Lomo Saltado with rice, onions and potatoes quiet disappointing. The meat was chewy and the sides were not special. I left thinking that I could have got a similar experience getting to go from Safeway or at one of those $9.99 buffets located in the suburbs or in some bad neighborhood. 

It wasn't my worst experience with Peruvian food but I left very disappointed. I can see this joint going out of business really soon; I just can't see any guest coming back to this place after a first visit.
author: Monica G.

description:
Service is pretty good! Waitress are great

Seviche de pescado is amazing!

I love their arroz con camarones and their lomo saltado tender steak with fries is awesome!

Anticuchos on point!  Over all 5 stars
author: Don Y.

description: Solid Peruvian Chinese place with fresh and delicious ceviche and out of this world chicharon de pollo. We came here on a Sunday for lunch and had a wonderful spread which included Ceviche Mixto, Chicharon de pollo, Lomo Saltado, and house special chow fun. Their Peruvian fair is solid, fresh, and on point while their Peruvian chinese offerings are just as good. I can't wait to come back.
author: Taffany H.

description: The Lomo Saltado is sublime and the story behind the restaurant is beautiful. Authentic Peruvian cuisine at it's finest matched with the kindest and best service. It's my favorite go-to for purely delicious Peruvian food over other spots like Limon which is fairly commercial these days. Love you guys!
author: Paul P.

description:
THANK YOU very much for finally having a restaurant that  brings the AUTENTIC  flavors from Peru to San Francisco. 

AMAIZING !
author: Daniela L.

description:
Peruvian with Chinese flair!  Love it!!!  

Parking may suck in this neighborhood but worth the trouble.  Can't go wrong with their Lomo Saltado but this place also embrace the diversity of San Francisco by creatively offering some widely known Chinese/Asian dishes like the noodle (chow fun) and fried rice. 

The service is also exceptional.  I have a friend in our group with some diet restriction.  They'll accommodate some personal request so you won't compromised you food allergies, etc.

Great for big groups.
author: Elna K.

description: Just consumed so much food here. Simply the best flavor combinations around. So fresh and expertly prepared. I can't wait to come back! Maybe even tomorrow. Definitely worth the money!
author: Zelda S.

description:
Sitting here writing a review while my tummy is happy and full of Peruvian food. 

This has become one of my favorite no frills places to get Peruvian food, or Peruvian style Chinese food if I ever crave it. Definitely came here on a much more eventful night with a soccer game on tv and locals hanging out long after finishing their meals to watch, but our non-soccer viewing party didn't feel out of place. The servers here are very friendly and welcoming, making it feel like I'm just eating at a relative's house with their easy going conversation and banter. Their recommendations were spot on and our party loved everything ordered!
author: Wendy N.

description: This was delicious. I ordered online and it came as promised on time. I did try to call and order but the line was busy, oh well. The food was great, my dad loved the Lomo Saltado. The Yucca Frita was perfect.  All around great, I would definitely order here again. I do wish it was less pricey, but that won't stop me from eating it again
author: J S.

description:
Except for the ceviche mixto, which was quite good, the overpriced meal was bland and underwhelming. Roast chicken was over cooked and tasteless. The special, a pot roast, was tender but sat in a huge pool of bland beans (think almost refried but without much spice). Another dish, featured tough chunks of beef with potatoes that, after frying, were mixed with the beef and tomatoes in a fairly tasty sauce.

This was a $100 meal (including tip) that would have been more easily digested at $60. Still, the food wouldn't taste any better. Never again.
author: Scott S.

description:
Peruvian Food I have missed you!

Coming from Miami, the dearth of South American food has been depressing. Sure, the Mexican and Asian is far superior, but hard to leave your roots. So when I found myself in... Crocker-Amazon and right near a Peruvian place with 4 stars, I had to check it out.

Pretty empty on a Monday night, but I was fine by that. The staff quickly handed me a menu and told me in Spanish that one side was traditional Peruvian, and the other side was Chifa - Peruvian Chinese. While I love my chaufas, I had had plenty of Chinese and Filipino over the weekend and wanted the classics. But that lead to another difficult decision as it all sounds great. Ultimately I had trouble decided between the arroz con mariscos (paella) and the lomo saltado. My waitress even brought over another staff member and they looked on in pity as both are highly recommended.

Ultimately I went with the paella and had no complaints. Out came a delicious plate full of saffron rice, with plenty of squid, 4 huge mussels, and at least one big shrimp. The flavor was excellent and definitely tasted like something I could get from Miami. ¡Estoy lleno!

That said, I still want to try the lomo saltado, the chaufas, so many things. But at least I have my Peruvian spot!
author: Michael C.

description:
I just moved into the neighborhood and decided to try this place out as my boyfriend and I have made it a quest to try all the food in the area now. I was definitely impressed with the food. The only other Peruvian restaurant I've visited is Limon, and I like El Porteno way better because the food is just as good but it's a lot cheaper. The service is okay. They promptly acknowledge and seat you which is good. 

I got the ceviche mixto and it's so darn good. I was also really impressed with the portion they gave us. YOU HAVE TO TRY THIS ONE!! This dish alone is enough to keep me coming here.

I also got the fried fish. The skin was crispy on the outside just the way fried fish is supposed to be. I kind of wish there was some kind of dipping sauce on the side though. But overall, this was a solid dish.

The only dish that was a miss for me was the chicharron de pollo. Both me and my boyfriend weren't a fan of this one. The chicken tasted dry and overcooked. We each ate one piece and didn't both to finish the plate.

Overall, this is a solid place. I will definitely try this place again and explore the menu more.
author: Cindy F.

description:
Until recently I'd only had El Porteno's empanadas from various catering gigs (also tasty).

Then I moved to the neighborhood and wanted to try the rest of the menu. I haven't ventured too deeply yet but I'll definitely be back! 

The portion-to-price ratio is great-- I got a very filling meal for 4 at a reasonable $40 with tip, whereas I used to live near a more popular Peruvian place in the Mission where the total for the same amount of food would easily have been double. I forgot exactly what I ordered, but everything was tasty. 

Only bummer is it's a little hit or miss on the pickup/delivery service. They don't deliver via Yelp/Eat24, but you can do a pickup order. The most recent time I went we placed a pickup order but they were short staffed so they hadn't made it by the time we arrived. They were really apologetic and nice but it took a good 30 minutes after we already had waited at home before picking it up. I remember thinking it was a good thing the food was awesome :)

Another time we tried to place an order but they were randomly closed due to emergency kitchen repair. We didn't find that out til we were _at_ the restaurant but to Eat24's credit they did try to contact us before and we just didn't see the call while driving. 

If you really can't leave the house, you can use Grubhub or Postmates for delivery.
author: Krista L.

description: I was looking for a good Peruvian restaurant in San Francisco and I think I found it. The food here was really good. The service was great too.
author: Ivan L.

description:
El Porteno is one of my favorite finds since moving from LA to the city. Let's cut to the chase - the food is amazing, the servers are generally attentive, they're almost always playing a Marc Anthony concert on the big screen, and the ambiance here is ... comfortable. I like the decor and I always feel at home. 

We've tried a bunch of dishes, but you cannot go wrong with the ceviche. Sometimes we order two... and once we ordered two and another to go (is it clear we love the ceviche?). I also order the bistek a la pobre, which includes a large steak, plantains, an egg, and French fries. They serve the plantain whole, so if you're into phallic foods, this dish is definitely for you. 

I almost didn't want to share this place on Yelp, but I didn't feel right denying the city of such amazing ceviche. Enjoy!
author: Jane L.

description:
Delicious. The ceviche is exactly what I expected and wished for. Their food is flavorful and very rich in flavors. The chicha morada juice is also very tasty.
The service however is fairly slow. Only reason why they didn't get a 5 star.
author: Lola M.

description: I loveeeee el porteño. It's so hard to find Chifa so finding a place that sells both regular Peruvian food and chifa is already a solid 3 stars for me. The food and the service bump it up to 5 stars. The lomo saltado, tallarines verdes, and ceviche are amazing. The chaufa might as well taste like you got it somewhere in Lima. Definitely worth checking out!
author: Antonella H.

description:
I have finally been able to satisfy my Peruvian fix here in sf.  After going to Limon and came out not satisfied. I came across this place and it really took care of it.

El Porteno it's more authentic/home style cooked Peruvian food,  my only "complaints" are 1 there was no aji verde and 2 the chicha morada could have been a bit bolder as far as flavor goes.

We got papas a la huancaina which I've been craving for a while, it was delicious, the potatoes were cooked all the way and the huancaina sauce was perfect.
As a 2nd appetizer we got the ceviche mixto, wow the ceviche couldn't have been more perfect, it had a little bit of heat which added character to it.
I really wanted to get the causa de Cameron however since I got the papas a la huancaina we decided to skip on that.

As a main entree we got the lomo saltado and I gotta say I have no complaints perfect. For dessert we got alfajores and crema volteada, the alfajor was fresh and pleasant to bite into, and the crema volteada very rich.

I highly recommend this place if you're into authentic Peruvian food, by the way the Peruvian/Chinese dishes looked amazing.

We'll be back :)
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: Considering the location and ineffective parking this is truly an incredible restaurant. I was pleased after ordering the fish ceviche and lomo saltado. The inside is not that interesting but the food is quality.
author: Adonai T.

description: Tasty! A hidden gem in Excelsior neighborhood. Good mix of Peruvian and Chinese food. From appetizer to main course we're all so flavorful and rich.
author: Kay D.

description:
I think I didn't order the right thing.'

Just went on whim, easy street parking, in a less than desirable area of SF. But that's why I think it's probably authentic. 

I'm a sucker for pasta. I had the pasta porteno. Not sure if peruvian cuisine has a lot of pasta, but like I said, I'm a sucker. I saw pasta and huacaina sauce, and thought yeah that sounds good. And it was. Except, it was more like a creamy, off-alfredo, italian dish. Still great, but don't think I got the right flavor I suspect I should have gotten.

Also had the Lomo Saltado, which was much raved about by fellow Yelpers. And rightly so! The beef is tender and has enough flavor to separate it from a simple piece of steak. The sauce complements the rice, and I swear there is soy sauce in it (which wouldn't be a huge surprise, because on the back of the menu is Chinese food offerings!)

Ceviche - good, fresh, not the best I've had, but excellent nonetheless.

Will give this place another chance. Will try something that is not pasta.
author: Edward L.

description: Great food and quick service! Love the atmosphere. I would highly recommend giving this place a try for good Peruvian food
author: Alexandra S.

description:
Really wonderful family owned Peruvian restaurant.
I'm so happy to have discovered it.
They had a sweet peaceful and clean environment.
The food was delicious. They were friendly and gave wonderful suggestions and helped me make good appetizer and entrees choices!
The shrimp potato thing was soooooo freaking good. That yellow sauce. What are you?
Get back in my mouth!!! 
I'll definitely going back.
author: Tiana G.

description:
Looove this place!! First starting with the staff, always friendly (specially if they've seen you there before)
The food is really amazing (I've tried many other Peruvian places)
The ceviche mixto is my favorite sooo good and spicy :) The papas a la huancaina as well, really good. 
If you're up for a refreshing drink, try the Passion Fruit one.. sooo delicious! 
The environment is clean and always have great music, a tv playing videos of the corresponding songs..
Nice for the location even tho, parking around Geneva and Mission sucks! But it's all worth it 

Overall one of my fav places now :) and it's family owned..
author: Karis A.

description: I ordered three appetizers. Fried chicken pieces, fried yuca, and ceviche. All three were pretty good.
author: scott h.

description: The ceviche mixto was wonderful! This is a family owned restaurant with a vey extensive menu. We were both jonesing for ceviche, so no idea about the other dishes.  The owners son waited on us - a very personable young man - who told us about the various indigenous items on our plate ( there was this roasted large kernel corn that was amazing) and hipped us to a very nice Peruvian beer.  He also turned us on to Magnolia Brewery, which turned out to be great.  Reasonably priced - large portions.
author: Jeff K.

description:
Came here today for the first time with my husband because he told me the ceviche was really good, and he was right!! We ordered the ceviche mixto and it was the best I've ever had. Not too citrusy and the fish was really fresh. I also loved the sweet potato and corn that came with it because they added both sweetness and texture. 

I was in charge of choosing our entrée, the seafood saltado, and the hubby chose yucca fries. The Saltado was cooked perfectly because the calamari wasn't chewy and the onions and tomatoes weren't too soft. I loved the yucca fried as well because they weren't super greasy or dry.

Our waitress was really friendly and I wouldn't hesitate to come back. We might just become regulars ;-)
author: Steph L.

description: This might be one of the best Peruvian places I've tried...which is saying a lot given the sheer quantity of Peruvian places in the Bay Area. What set this one apart for me was it's simplicity, and just good food without any unnecessary fanciness. Bistek a lo pobre with platain was delicious. But the real winner for me was the Causa de Pollo. Cold chicken salad inside a mashed potato "puck." Ceviche pescado was perfectly spiced as well.
author: Stan K.

description: Great authentic Peruvian food, even the Asian Peruvian plates! Only downside is that drinks like Maracuya aren't from the fruit instead it's a flavoring similar to look-aide.
author: Angela C.

description:
Food = good. 

Chicharrones de pollo = crispy deep fried chicken (mostly dark meat with bone), delicious and crispy! Comes with a slightly sweet and tart lime dip. $7.98.

Lomo saltado = stir fry of tender strips of beef, tomato, sweet onion and potatoes in a great savory and tangy sauce, and comes with rice.  $14.98.

Sopa de pollo = large piping hot bowl of chicken noodle soup, full of vegetables, too. $10.98.

On the reverse side of their menu, they have Chinese food, too. 

Service = friendly but slow.  She never did refill my glass of water.  And she took a while to give us the change.  It appears that she was the only server.  

Seating = plenty. Mostly 4-tops. 

Prices = moderate. Dinner for two was $39.09.
author: Fannie S.

description: OMGEEZ!!!! Freakin delicious. Def coming back for more!! I had the Arroz con Mariscos, Chicharron de Pollo and Pepper Salted Prawns. Super delicious food is filled with so much flavor!!
author: Crystal S.

description: fyi this place is not the empanada place, but food is a-ok, never knew a place that sold chinese food as well as peruvian.
author: Phuc B.

description:
The only thing that comes to mind when I think of Chinese and Peruvian is how hot that combo is. And I ain't talking about the food; Hello Russell Wong and Christian Meier! Too bad, they can't make babies together. And too bad, I don't know anyone of that joint ethic makeup so I'll have to revert to talking about food. Boring I know...

El Porteno | Chifa Peruano is home to the only Chinese-Peruvian restaurant in SF (that I know of). It's basically the successors of Chifa Peruano (http://www.yelp.com/biz/chifa-peruano-san-francisco-2) with new owners and a more expensive menu. The prices aren't yipster expensive but at about 20-30% more than their old menu, it's a bit pricey for this more sketchy area of the city.

One side of the menu features your typical Americanized Chinese food while the other side features Peruvian items. Other than the ceviche, expect a carb heavy menu with lots of fried items and meat. Not a place I could eat at frequently because the food is heavy. For those who are sensitive to msg, El Porteno uses it even in their Peruvian items. Most of the sauces are premade beforehand with msg but you can ask that they chef prepare you something without it.

We started with the Causa de camarones ($8.95) which is basically a shrimp salad stacked between a mash potato mixture and topped with an aioli sauce: http://bit.ly/1m6kpim. Very creamy and delicious but I could detect some msg in the sauce as it numbed my tongue and made me thirsty. 

If you like fried food, El Porteno is the place for you. The Chicharron de pollo ($7.98) is a solid choice is you like chicken karaage: http://bit.ly/1hCkV2p. It was crunchy and moist. A dab of the citrus sauce helped cut through some of the richness. I'm not sure what possessed us to order another fried dish but we did. The Jalea ($14.98) is a must order if you're a fried calamari (or fried seafood) fan: http://bit.ly/Rv98wK. The combo of the fresh seafood and light, uber crunchy (not greasy) batter made this a winner. Loved the accompanying fried corn and pickled red onions. Too bad, I was fried out from out former dish to eat more of this dish.  

Initially, I wanted a stewed chicken dish for my entrée but the chef/owner told me the sauce they use is already made using msg. I was bummed but she offered to whip up a plate of her Lomo Saltado without msg and promised it would be good. I'm not a fan of Lomo Saltado, this is usually Mr. NSS' go-to dish but the chef/owner delivered on her promise. This was by far the best Lomo Saltado ($12.95) I've tried and was even better than La Mar's, Mi Lindo Peru's, and Limon's version: http://bit.ly/1m6kUZE. The strips of beef were incredibly tender and flavorful while the fries still maintained a slight crispness to them. That rice doe, perfectly al-dente with a subtle richness from the broth (?) it was cooked in. I gave my leftovers to Mr. NSS and he made it a point to text me at work at how good it was. 

They do serve pisco sour but it's premade from a bottle. Being responsible adults now, my childhood bff and I chugged chicha moradas (Peruvian purple corn drink) instead. Such a far cry from waking up and wondering how we got home. We're all grown up now!

Service from the chef/owner was very sweet and timely. I really appreciated that she was forthcoming about the use of msg (so many restaurants claim to not use it and I later find out the hard way that they do) and did her best to make sure our dishes were free from it. My only minor gripe is they charge $1-$1.50 for to-go boxes. What the heezy?!

If you're ever in this neck of the woods and Popeye's across the street is too hood for you, give El Porteno a shot. Not literally of course. Happy Friday!
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Ordered the Pescado a lo macho. Slightly spicy. The calamari were cooked perfectly but wasn't the greatest fan of the Basa. Aside from the fact that my rice was a teeny bit hard , the overall flavor was good. Nothing fancy about this restaurant and parking can be tough, but I was happy with my meal and the what people ordered at other tables looked tasty.
author: Krystal T.

description:
First time here, our waiter (younger guy..maybe the son?) was so nice and took the time to explain their specialties to us. Great service and food looks home style and authentic, everything was delicious! Portion was huge but did not sacrifice flavor. My neighborhood Peruvian place is Fresca but for the price, portion, quality, and warm service I'd come back. Ordered the lomo saltado, arroz con mariscos, flan, and a Peruvian dark lager. Everything highly recommended. 

ps the restaurant itself is very family style, unpretentious / not fancy. If your date loves local joints and down to earth dining, stop by :)
author: Liz L.

description: What nonsense definitely not coming back one piece of chicken and a large Salad? Never in life have I been to a place ordered from a place where a menu item is called 'chicken' and yet what you get the least of is chicken .  I could go to pollo supremo for the same price and get a whole fucking chicken.
author: David C.

description:
I ate here once a week for takeout: Lomo saltado, Chicharron de Pollo, Arroz con pollo +1
Ridiculously good
author: Mike Y.

description: Horrible staff, mediocre food. Stay way. If you give them feedback, they will verbally abuse you. Very unprofessional.
author: E M.

description: Don't let the look of the restaurant fool you. They make really delicious Peruvian food here! We were skeptical at first because the restaurant was pretty empty and it looked old and ghetto, which are typical indicators of a bad meal. Boy, was I wrong. Their chicken dishes don't look nor sound like anything special but the chicken was seasoned perfectly and tender to the bite. The paella was a bit mushy but flavorful. The Lomo Salatado (beef with sautéed onions) was delicious. I think my favorites were the grilled chicken with pesto pasta and beef Lomo Salatado.
author: Thao T.

description:
WOW, this place is awesome! I love Peruvian food and this is Chinese-Peruvian food(chifa). Not commonly known, Lima/Peru is considered the culinary capital of South America and the food here is reflective of that. Must try dishes include the loma Salado, cilantro rice, paella, picante de mariscos(it's a creamy dish with potato's on the bottom), chicharron de pollo and ceviche. 

I haven't wandered over to the Chinese side of the menu but I see promise there.

The interior is wood panel and looks old but don't let that fool you. Only bad thing is the parking which is tough but well worth the effort.
author: Mike H.

description: Hello people of this world ! Let me tell you guys about my experience at El Porteño today being my 2nd time eating here .The 1st time I ate here was great! Me and my wife loved the food that's why we came back. This place is my top #2 restaurant I highly recommend this spot amazing food ! But!!!!!! Hold on we had  a big problem with our server very rude and bad !!!!! Customer service I think her name was Sonia !!! Because of her rude service I almost left but because of victor handling it in a respectful manner we ended up staying . In front of many customers Sonia seem like she was ready to fight us or something we felt embarrassed because of her and we felt uncomfortable because she kept looking at us eat with this mean look with another lady that looks like it could been a sister of her. I really don't know when the next time I'll come back. But thanks victor for the well customer service he has .good job keep it up!  Food wise 5stars customer service I don't know what if I had kids here and Sonia acted how she did ! What if?....... la Comida buenaza I've been to 15 Peruvian restaurants this is my #2
author: Saia F.

description: Was impressed by this place, nice stuff, food is great, didn't expect from El Porteno such a good food. Thanks
author: Denny D.

description: Very nice place! Great food and waiter was very helpful and helping me choose a good dish. I ordered the lomo saltado very good! Will be back thanks for the experience
author: Amro M.

description: Review is for delivery via Postmates. Everything we ordered was fantastic! Ordered a mix of dishes off the chifa and the criollo menus. Yuca frita, chicharron de pollo, and the Chuleta de chancho con sal y pimienta were all fried perfectly and still crispy/crunchy after delivery. The Ceviche mixto, chow fun de carne, and the lomo saltado were all delicious. Both the pesto sauce and the chicken were fantastic in the tallarin verde con pollo a la parrilla. Portions were good sized. Looking forward to trying even more dishes next time! Definitely the best Peruvian in SF, and not overpriced like a few others.
author: j k.

description: Excellent food! Started out with the causa de camaron and it was perfect! Creamy, rich, and some bite at the end. Mama had the saltado de mariscos and it was delicious , generous serving of a seafood medley . Shrimp, mussels, calamari . I had there grilled chicken with pesto pasta, the marinade on the chicken was so tasty and freshly made on the grill. Pasta was creamy and went really well with the chicken. Parking is hard, service is good, I'll definitely return
author: Ladyreyes R.

description: This wasn't good. The Lomo Saltado tasted like someone rubbed it under their arms before serving it. The ceviche de pescado had an over powering chili flake flavor. So I don't know if it's good. The papa la huancaina was so bland. No flavor at all. All in all, pretty disappointing. I won't be back. I'll just wait until I visit LA to go to my favorite Peruvian joints.
author: Lyda C.

description:
I wanted to find a restaurant that offers different kind of taste and I found El Porteno on Yelp. 
Given the appearance of the restaurant from the outside, the way the menu was layout and printed, I didn't have high expectation. The freshness of the food and how tasty everything was surprised me. The waitress was super nice and after I asked her what's the most popular Peruvian dish here, she recommended and I ordered the Lomo Saltado. The food was really good and it was exactly what I needed. This place is now on my list of places to go for lunch or dinner.
author: Boban V.

description: Old School Daly City pages on Facebook recommends this restaurant to all friends & familia enjoy you`re food
author: Ruben B.

description: Had a late lunch at El Porteno with a Peruvian friend.  Loved the place.  The decor is kitschy and dated (60's fake wood paneling and Peruvian souvenirs on the wall), service is slow, although friendly.  The food I had was exemplary, though.  Fresh, tangy ceviche was perfect.  And the paella, or arroz con mariscos---loaded with calamari, mussels and prawns---was terrific.  Perfectly seasoned and very tasty.
author: Norman R.

description:
As soon as I moved to San Francisco my mission to find the best Peruvian restaurant started. I have been to many Peruvian restaurants in the city and by far El Porteno is my favorite place. For the past three years El Porteno has been my go to Peruvian restaurant. 

What I love: 
Causa de Pollo
Causa de Camarones*
Cebiche Mixto*
Anticuhos de Corazon
Tallarin Verde* 
Pescado a lo Macho*
Lucuma 
Alfajores*

*MUST GET/FAVORITES: 
Cause de Camarones is by far one of the best causes I have ever had. I like that it has enough shrimp. They top it off with a quarter of a boil egg and huancaina sauce (amazing)! Their Cebiche Mixto is one of the cubits that its actually worth the price, since many restaurants have a small portion of it. Tallarin Verde is my boyfriends personal favorite one. Their meat size is a good size, most Peruvian restaurants tend to give you a small size, which is ridiculous considering Peruvian cuisine is known for their huge portion sizes. The tellurian verde is amazing! Its super creamy! Now, my personal favorite one, I ALWAYS HAVE TO get this dish. This dish comes with a side of white rice, tilapia fish topped with scallops, mussels, calamari, shrimp, etc and covered with their yummy orange sauce. My boyfriend decides that we should share this dish all the time, since its his favorite as well. ( and I never want to share it, I need all od ) This is by far the best Peruvian dish even though people prefer Lomo Saltado, which I still don't understand and never will. The Alfajores are also one of the best ones that I have ever had. 

Highly recommend everyone tries this restaurant. The food is great, great prices, and  staff is nice.
author: Alondra J.

description: One of my favorite peruvian restaurants to go to while im in the city! Love the chicha, yuca and ceviche de pescado.  Inside the restaurant feels like home, so many great peruvian decorations.  Parking is horrible but food is worth the wait!
author: Johanna A.

description: .... definetely one of the best places for peruvian food. unfortunatelly they lack of service knowldege or service standards. I always prefer take out food than seating there...hopefully they fix the seevice issue.. food still awsome
author: Yuri C.

description: First time here . Our waiter was drunk reek with alcohol ! Unbelievable and to top it off she spilled the water drink on the table and all Over my son .. certain food was ok and other we tried was super high in sodium and very salty ... I don't know what the hell went on but the restaurant having a bad day and so un professional .. not again
author: Peter R.

description: The food is good but the service sucks! At least a smile geez.... Heka rude waitresses!!!
author: Jenny P.

description:
We did take out on a cold, rainy night.

I love my Peruvian, and we were excited when this place opened up near my boyfriends casa.

Walking in the place was a lot larger then I was expecting, and I enjoyed the Peruvian Art on the walls. The staff greeted us right away and gave us menus to look over. The menus are laid out really simply, Peruvian on one side and Chinese on the other. 

We ordered and were seated, and decided to try the pre-made Pesco drinks they had. 
Traditional Pesco Sour - Tasty and Frothy!
Passion Fruit Pesco - Fruits and floral with a little froth.
A-OK for us!

Dinner came out fast and we hung around finishing our drinks before taking our Take-Out home.

Lomo Saltado: Not too shabby. A LOT of fried and fair amount of meat, the fries soaked up the juice nicely. Meat was tender in some places and chewy in others. Tomatoes were juicy and cooked well. Rice was great and loved that is soaked up the spices and juices.

Ceviche Mixto: I REALLY liked the Ceviche, I thought the spice was good, the quality of fish was solid and it had the nice strong citrus flavor. I was most impressed with their calamari, it wasn't chewy at all. However, my boyfriend J would have liked more spice and more citrus. 

This place is perfect for a rainy, lazy day. I like having good ceviche so close. 
I'd happily return.
author: Meghan L.

description:
Just had lunch here with my husband and it was great!! We're originally from NY and have had a lot of Peruvian food before so we weren't sure about  this spot in the neighborhood. But it was delicious. 
The restaurant itself is basic. This is not fine dining. However the waitresses were attentive the food was so so good and the prices were fair for the huge portions. We had the Lomo Saltado and the Seco with rice and beans. If you're in the hood check this place out.
author: Angela C.

description:
Peruvian with a twist of chinese for those who like "non-american style" Chinese food. Perfect price point. I trekked to east San Francisco: Excelsior (Geneva & Mission) The restaurant tucked near the local pool hall is no frills, straight to the point  Peruvian/Chinese Oasis. 

I had only one thing in mind "Paella" (fifteen-fifty) full of buttery rice, shrimp, mussels, squid, clams, simmering in beautiful aroma spices. I came, I ate, I left stuffed and satisfied. I will come back and try more of the Peruvian variates this restaurant has to offer.
author: Eui O.

description:
Where the eff have I've been?! I grew up in this neighborhood and it's my first time here? Wow...I've been missing out!!

This restaurant just officially became one of my favorites! 

Here is what I have tried so far:

*Seafood soup with rice and cilantro sauce
*Pesto pasta with grilled chicken
*Lomo Saltado
*Ceviche Pescado
*Mussels

Everything was absolutely delicious and I'm impressed with this little gem. Can't wait to go back and try their Peruvian chicken next....yummmmmm!
author: Rose L.

description:
I love this family run restaurant -- the food is generous and comforting. The ambiance is simple and homey, and the waiter was the cook's son, who took the time to explain each dish to our party, since we had a few people in our group who were noobs to the cuisine of Peru.
      
Starting with the appetizers, we ordered and shared: Ceviche de Pescado, Causa Rellena with chicken, and Chicharron de Pollo.  The seafood in the ceviche was fresh, and the dish very light and delicious.  The Causa Rellena was a great, cool appetizer -- though deceptively filling. Don't bother with the Chicharron de Pollo.  It is just fried chicken on the bone (chicken leg?). The chicken was chopped up, so you end up getting chicken bone shrapnel in your mouth -- very unappealing.

For the main courses, we ordered from the Peruvian side of the menu (will try the Peruvian Chinese next time): The Arroz Con Mariscos -- chock full of seafood -- was absolutely delicious; The Lomo Saltado with any of the proteins available (but beef and prawns are preferred). This dish is great in both quality and quantity. Now pay attention Yelpers: I know the last thing on your mind is to order the pesto pasta (Tallarin Verde) -- but DO IT!!! Yes, just do it. You'll thank me later. Get it with the grilled beef or chicken. Get it by itself. Just do it.

Finally, for dessert...a little coffee, and...a little Alfajor: 2 humble cookies, dusted with powdered sugar, sandwiching the most decadent, smooth, luscious, caramel. Coffee + Alfajor = Heaven.
author: Rachel V.

description: I've eaten here a few a times. Their empanadas are so good i often to stop and get one to snack on whenever i am at the ferry building. Ive enjoyed all of the different varieties ive tried, but by far my favorite is the lamb braised in Malbec with chimichuri dipping sauce. If you dont care for lamb then...
author: Ralph M.

description: Good food, especially the ceveche mixta, a little pricey for what you get.Service was also some what spotty
author: Jim S.

description:
I came on a Friday at 5pm and finding parking here was difficult. I would suggest you come with a friend and have them circle while you grab the food. Or uber/muni is an option of course.

Also, a lot of the workers don't speak English. After I placed my Eat24 order, The estimated time the food would be ready was 10-35 min. So I gave the restaurant a call to see when I should come pick up the food, and the lady just kept answering "hello?" because she didn't know how to speak English.

But the most important part... the food is AMAZING. I'm so glad I found this gem! I ordered the Lomo Saltado and my friend got the seafood paella. I couldn't pick which one was better. They're both so flavorful and delicious. They do not skimp on the seafood in the paella. The meat in the Lomo Saltado is juicy, tender, and bursting with flavor.

Can't wait to introduce my boyfriend to this place!
author: Jennifer C.

description: I have been going to this place since I was little with my parents and it wasn't until a few years ago I saw how much I love the food! My favorite food is Peruvian so this great. Everytime I eat here I have to get me their home made Chicha drink or Inca cola, its only right. I start off with the deep fried yuca which comes with an amazing home made spicy sauce! I also love their Papa a la Huancaína its a must have whenever I eat Peruvian. I must say their Lomo Saltado is AMAZING. Right texture of meat and potatoes and rice are freshly made. I always leave satisfied. MUST GO if you're in the Mission!
author: Alexander H.

description: We ordered Ceviche and Lomo Saltado. Both dishes were so good and the people working there were very friendly. Highly recommend this place for people who like Peruvian food.
author: Duong N.

description:
Had a really great experience here with friends- definitely worth it to come back! Service was great as well and it was easy to find parking. Portion-sizes are great for the price. A few of my favorites:
-Arroz con Mariscos - Paella - I've had better but this dish had great flavor. Still delicious!
-Picante de Mariscos - Seafood stew- My favorite dish; the spices/sauce seem similar to the paella but creamier. 
-Ceviche Mixto - Portion was great, fresh and had a strong flavor. 
-Roast Chicken - It was delicious and not dry like I would've thought. Great flavor. Only available weekends. It also came with a side of salad and fries.
author: Allyson L.

description:
Almost every Sunday after church we come to have dinner here. The place is cozy and the food is very good and IT'S not too expensive! I'm peruvian and my dad cooks delicious, I am very picky with peruvian food but this place is one of my favorites. The food never disappoints. 
Casi todos Los domingos despues de Iglesia, vinimos a cenar aquí. El lugar es cómodo, la atención es buena y la comida es muy rica, y no muy cara. Disfrutamos siempre la comida nunca nos decepcionan!! Uno de mis favoritos.
author: Suely R.

description: This place is awesome, it's open late and a great spot for last minute dinner plans. The service was super friendly and made me feel very comfortable with trying something new. Highly recommend to anyone in the neighborhood.
author: Charley P.

description: Bad experience, not recommended , never back again, waitress bad aptitude, some food are OK but mostly not real Peruvian food or Chinese food, over charged
author: Manuel W.

description:
I have been coming to this restaurant since i was in my mothers womb, now 20 years later I have brung family and friends with the old owners.

The new owners give u a uncomfortable look sometimes. The food is good still no doubt for keeping the taste like the old owners. Overall just there service is rude. Every time we would go theres always a annoyed tone in the server or anyone there actually. 

One day I want to say it was a Friday not sure, my family and i go to the restaurant and we noticed the gate is closed but saw customers inside still so we assumed it was due to the construction outside. We open the gate to go inside, literally seconds walking in we hear the lady yell out "WE ARE CLOSED!! COME BACK AT 4:30 WHEN WE OPEN AGAIN" we got there at 2, no way im going to wait that much time when the meter is running. So loud, rude and overall humiliating since everyone in the restaurant starred at my family and I. Without a word we turn around and go home. 

If you're going to close the restaurant between the hours of operations wouldn't it be a good idea to have a sign of the hours when you will close and re open. Not just when the restaurant will be open till you close at the end of the night. 

I wont be returning to my childhood fav restaurant. I just had it with the new owners. I come all the way from piedmont just to come here. What a waste of gas , time and worst of all the traffic we had to go thru going and back. Oh lets not forget about the parking, yet i would do all this and more for my dish. Lol lost a valuable family who order's usually between $40-70 a check. Plus tip.

Call ahead if u wanna dine here, see if you're worth being opened and cared for.

Only reason why its a two star because of the food, old owners and my memories with all my family here.

Good luck.
author: Yvette S.

description:
This place deserves more recognition than it currently does.
Food is fantastic, way better than Fresca. It feels like a home-cooked meal. 
We got the seafood rice, and the cubed beef with potatoes. Both were amazing.
I live 10 min from this place and I'm questioning myself for not knowing about this place earlier
author: Alan T.

description:
Hands down the best lomo saltado in the city.

I've searched far and wide throughout the city to find the best Peruvian food and this restaurant is definitely the winner. The lomo saltado is my favorite, along with the ceviche. I've also tried the Chinese food here and it's pretty delicious. 

Just thinking about this place makes my mouth water.
author: Christina A.

description:
I honestly wanted to vomit. Came here for take out because of the great yelp reviews but sadly the moment I walked in the placed smelled like must. 

Ordered the lomo Saltado, pollo Saltado, yuca fries and some alfajores cookies. Everything was goss except for the French fries in the dish. The chicken tasted so weird and the yuca fries were hard as a rock. 

As for the Alfajore cookies, they looked amazing but were a real disappointment and a waste of $5 on 2 cookies. For the same price you can get real delicious alfajores from Sabores Del Sur which is sold at  whole foods bakery and alemany farmers market.

Food made my friend & I completely sick. I knew I should of walked out the moment I walked in but we were hungry and the food was ready. You live and you learn!
author: Ella P.

description:
Food is ON POINT. The ceviche mixto and lomo saltado are my go-tos. Restaurant service is friendly. However, ordering may be difficult if you don't know Spanish. Just point to the selection on the menu :)
I was surprised to see Chinese food on the menu. There were a few tables with fried rice. Looked yums!
I also ordered takeout through EAT24 with no problem. Food was ready within the estimated time frame and the guy was very nice when I picked it up. LAAAAV
author: B Y.

description: I have been to Peru and to other Peruvian restaurants in the city, so I can honestly say this is the best in San Francisco! For those of you who like Limón in the mission, do yourself a favor and come here instead. It may not feel as fancy, but the food is much better. A little out of the way if you don't live in the excelsior but worth the journey! Hop on the 14 bus if you don't drive or use ride share apps. Personally I don't like to hand 5 star reviews out, but this is better than 4 stars. Couldn't do 4.5 so I had to round up. The service was good, the food was great and the price is reasonable for Peruvian food in San Francisco.
author: Jason C.

description:
I was recommended to come here from one of my Peruvian clients. She said that out of all the Peruvian restaurants in the city, this place is the most legit. I've tried Mi Lindo Peru, Limon, Fresca, and a Peruvian Food Truck from Off the Grid and this is by far THE BEST! Fresca at this point looks like Mcdonalds Gringo ceviche compared to El Porteno. The location is at one of the busier intersections in the city so it's kind of difficult to find parking. The space itself is dated with 70's wooden panel walls and Peruvian decor....I kind of dig it though lol. 
The ceviche doesnt come with chips like at other places but rather white beans and pine nuts to balance out the extremity of the ceviche. It's definitely delicious and it's definitely A MUST TO ORDER.

The Lomo Saltado was perfectly marinated the the yuca fries had a nice crispy bite to them without getting too soggy from the sauce. It's a good safe dish to order, but I'm going to venture to something different when i come back!

We were the only customers inside so service was prompt. Definitely will become a regular in this 94112 gem!
author: Adlyn S.

description: LOVED this restaurant! Ordered: Chicharron de pollo: fried chicken, Lomo Saltado: strips of steak, onions and tomatoes served over a bed of rice with french fries, and bistek a lo pobre: marinated steak served with rice, french fries, eggs & a plantain ALL were delicious! There are so many more items on the menu that I want to try, I cant wait to go back.
author: Ashley D.

description:
Honestly I use to come here all the time before they changed owners and what not. The server said that it was same cooks and everything was going to be delicious. 
Food came out late and wasn't as good as I remembered. The prices are too high for the amount of food you get. The waitress was rude and had attitude. Sad to say that I won't be returning here and I don't recommend this place.
author: Karina A.

description: There food is really good! Good Service as well. I hate that I can never find parking but besides that if you just want a quick pick up order ahead of time and your meal will be ready!
author: Danette D.

description: Went there yesterday and i got the bistek alo pobre it was bomb  im peruvian  this is  the authentic stuff not the white wash peruvian food like fresca,  dis is the real deal .....thumbs up
author: Javier E.

description: Ceviche here is excellent and affordable. Must have. Noodle dish was well seasoned. Service was good.
author: Will D.

description:
Have no concerns about the neighborhood. It is a melting pot in an old school neighborhood that will never be a 24th Street or Valencia corridor. My wife and I went here twice just to make sure the food was really that good and it is!  Last night we tried the Paella which was both flavorful and plentiful. We also tried some of the "Chinese" food on which Chef Sylvia puts a slightly Peruvian slant.  Delicious! 

The prices are good considering the quality of the dishes. In a neighborhood of Popeyes Chicken and Dominos Pizza, El Porteno is a real find.  Chef Sylvia knows what she is doing! Food is obviously a passion.

The decor is simple, and the place is clean. We have already decided to become regulars. Check it out and I think you will decide that as well!
author: Joe B.

description: I come here a lot. This place never disappoints. I always come out of this place feeling good. Prices are super reasonable and portions good. THIS IS THE BEST PERUVIAN RESTAURANT IN SF. I totally think everyone should try this place out. It needs to be recognized more. Definitely one of the greats.
author: Jose R.

description: Very good and authentic Peruvian food. I liked that they have Chinese dishes too. The wonton soup was delicious. Papa a la Huancaina was great. My husband loved the anticuchos. The best fish we tried was the pesto seafood pasta. I tried sharing the lucuma ice cream with my daughter but it was so good we each had to order a cone to go. We will definitely come back!
author: Amy P.

description: HANDS DOWN. BEST FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD. period. Every plate was fantastic. I have never been to any restaurant where EVERYTHING was delicious. The service was good but the attitude of our server was bad. He hated his job. But seriously, i would fly out to SF just to eat at this restaurant. Next time I am in SF I have to come back here. My favorite dish was the mussels and the ceviche.
author: Juna C.

description: For the 100th time!!! Best lomo saltado and tallarines verdes in town!!!! This Chinese Peruvian restaurant has food reminiscent of my country closest to my heart, can't get enough of it :) and make sure you try the picarones too!!!
author: Carmen H.

description:
I was so sad when the old Chifa closed its doors. I thought it was gone for good, but fortunately they just remodeled and become El Porteño, with a snazzy new menu, pisco sours, a better atmosphere... and (sigh) higher prices. Fortunately, this place knows it's still in the ass-end of the city so the prices have simply gone from "rock bottom" to "reasonable." If you do come here, it's helpful to speak enough Spanish to be able to hold a simple conversation and order your food as some of the wait staff are monolingual, but it's not necessary; they'll just wave over someone bilingual for you if they have to. 

Lomo saltado was amazing: flavorful with nice sauteed beef and wonderfully fluffy rice. The pisco I got was a little sweet, but since it was three or four bucks cheaper than most peruvian restaurants, I'm not going to complain too much. If you're in the area and have a hankering for something you won't get anywhere else, you should give El Porteño a try! How many times in your life will you get to say that you ate Peruvian style Chinese food?
author: Aaron Y.

description: Menu includes both Chinese & Peruvian food. Both are delicious!! Service is friendly and food is tasty. What a gem!
author: j k.

description: My Peruvian friends took me to this place, and I must agree, this place is as good as it gets for Peruvian comfort food. Everything here is delicious and tastes home cooked. The lomo saltado, fried wontons, and the pesto steak....so good.
author: Priscilla M.

description: In the middle of all the chaos going on outside is this little peruvian gem. Definitely some of the best authentic peruvian food I have ever tasted. We had a variety of food at our table and nothing was anything less than perfection. I will definitely be back next time I'm in the area
author: Edgar G.

description: My husband and I decided to try this place since it was close to home. We were not impressed. We had bad service and the food wasn't good either.  Left with a headache and feeling queasy. Would not recommend this restaurant to any of my friends.
author: Cel O.

description: This is some of the best food i have ever had. I am personally black and was skeptical at first but when you take that first bite out the rice arroz and pollo. It was just smacking after a long days work. Definitely the place to be at
author: Azziz I.

description: best peruvian in SF. not even close. I'm peruvian, I know this stuff. congrats for pulling off seafood, criollo AND Chinese peruvian. everything was great.
author: Sebastian M.

description:
So, I really wanted to like this place.  I had such high hopes, yes finally Peruvian so close to me!
I was definitely not happy.

I went here super excited with family hoping we could all enjoy some great Peruvian. Since, come on, it is DELICIOUS. 
Instead I had rude service right when I entered.  They put us at a table and came to check on us only when we had to flag down the waitress.  She made a big deal out of us asking for ice in our water, when we were literally the only people there.

We stayed anyways and got food that was just under being "okay."
The chicken was strange where it didn't have the texture as it should or the taste.  My girlfriend decided to not even eat any of it.  The rest was just basic.  In my Lomo Saltado, the only thing with flavor were the tomatoes.  So unfortunate.

Then when we went to pay the bill, the waitress avoided us as long as possible and rolled her eyes every chance she got.  
I'd never recommended this place to a friend.
author: Jessica S.

description: First time eating Peruvian food at this spot, got the Bistec a la Pobre and it gave me a foodgasm! It's a rice plate with beef, fried banana, eggs and french fries. It's $15 but I promise you that it's really good and for the portion they give you, it's worth the money. I think this place is very underrated. Everyone should give these guys a chance!
author: Keng G.

description: I have tried at least 6 or so Peruvian restaurants in sf (limon, mi lindo, fresca to name a few) and although the food (lomito saltado) was good and decently portioned to fill ones appetite It wasn't amazing nor was the location. I don't mind the the slightly old school awkward feel of the place, but a place like this is usually somewhere you can take your family for an affordable delicious dinner. Main point im getting at is that it wasn't worth almost $16 a plate. I would have been happier if it was more moderately priced or there was something else to go with my entree that made me feel alright to be paying so much for a simple plate.
author: Yosof R.

description: We ordered multiple dishes, the anticuchos were great, the Lomo saltado was juicy and tasty, the Bistec a lo pobre was well served,  I ordered choros a La chalaca, knowing that cold seafood dishes should not be ordered at night time if you want the fresh, the choros were great, tasted fresh and with the perfect amount of aji, the arroz con mariscos had tons of mariscos. My favorite was the wor Wanton soup and the fried wanton, just like in Peru. Service was fast, the place was clean and the prices were very decent compare to other peruvian restaurants. Will be back for sure.
author: Claudia B.

description: We tried this place for dinner, and it was really good. Local atmosphere (nothing fancy), with great food and good prices. We ignored the Chinese menu, and had the Peruvian food. The seafood paella was especially amazing! I'll be back just for that.
author: S D.

description: Oh, El Porteno. What can I say about you? Nothing bad. Food are great. Service is friendly. Their orange chicken is awesome. I mean real awesome. Lomo Saltado is great too, as well as their Arroz con Pollo (Cilantro rice chicken). Oh, get their Peruvian drinks. All of them are great. However, parking is hard though.
author: Finu L.

description: Best resemblance of Peruvian cuisine in SF, best lomo saltado ever tasted, the price is fair. The environment is so Peruvian: rustic, with Cuzco portraits and decorations surrounded by some "chifa" (chinese peruvian) theme, yes CHIFA dishes are included in the menu which makes it very unique. Most importantly, the food is incredible, highly  recommended.
author: H C.

description: I have been going here, for over two years and the food keeps getting better and better, I recommend this place, fresh foods and great flavor.
author: Fracisca A.

description: By far the best Peruvian spot in the Bay Area!!! We had the causa, parihuela, ceviche and lomo saltado. If you are looking for AUTHENTIC Peruvian this is the place!!! We will be coming back!
author: Caitlin D.

description: Went there on a rainy sunday as it was close to home.  The place was bustling with many Latino families. I ordered the seafood pasta with huaicana sauce. It was tasty but for $14,99 I should have received more than just a plate - maybe bread/salad, etc. If you were to go to a Salvadoran restaurant a few blocks away, you would pay $3.00 less and get a lot more food for your money. Put dish was tasty. Next time will try to ceviche. Had Peruvian beer as well - Cristal ($4). Good place to speak Spanish as most staff assume you are hispano parlante.  Maybe I'd return - I don't know.
author: Dan L.

description: The Peruvian food served here is mediocre at best. Their food is edible if you are hungry and haven't ate for days but it is definitely not the best Peruvian food you will find at other locations within SF. I actually stumbled into this Peruvian restaurant and being Peruvian myself, I always open to tasting new Peruvian restaurants.    When filling out a review I want to equally consider the service I received here to give you a clear picture why I had to give them a low score. I walked in and they had very nice traditional Peruvian decor on the walls. Good first impression if you like a rustic feel.  I had just picked up my dad from the airport so he was pretty hungry.  He ordered seafood paella, tallarin saltado de carne, arroz chafe, and of course a Cuzquena beer.  I wasn't as hungry so I ordered 1/4 of their pollo la brasa.  I had a choice of doing the half chicken or 1/4 but again because I wasn't very hungry I figured 1/4 would do.  Being the good Peruvian daughter than I am I texted my mom asking her if she wanted me to bring her some Peruvian food to go. Coincidentally, she asked for 1/4 of pollo la brasa.  After taking my order the waitress never came back to my table so I got out of chair and walked up to the kitchen area and told the waitress I wanted to change my order and actually get half a chicken.  She proceeded to tell me she could NOT sell me the 1/2 chicken and could only do two orders of the 1/4 of chicken. I was incredibly confused. Rather than selling me half a chicken at the half chicken price, she wanted to upcharge me and get an extra few bucks off of me by charging me the premium price of 2 1/4 portions of chicken.  Sounds confusing? Sounds stupid? Well it is. It's actually very dumb and very insulting especially for a new customer. Mind you, my food hasn't even been served yet. My food hadn't even been cooked yet and she looked at me straight in the eye and attempted to swindle me right in me face.  That speaks volumes. I was very turned off by her lack of service that I would not recommend this place to any of my friends or family.
author: Joanna G.

description:
I'm from Peru and I have tried many Peruvian restaurants in the Bay Area and this is one of the better ones by far. This is not a fancy place, nor is it located in the best part of town. But the food alone is worth coming for. It's authentic and really good, portions are big and prices are very reasonable. Also, one of our friends has eaten at this restaurant 6 times already so she knew all the best dishes in the menu.

Our Favorites
Chicha Morada
Anticucho
Lomo saltado 
Picarones
Tallarin verde con Bisteck
Arroz con mariscos

Overall, we were pleasantly surprised to find this gem. I highly recommend El Porteno to anyone who is looking for good authentic Peruvian food.
author: Elena C.

description: Just left the restaurant and I have to say that we (party of 7) left extremely happy, happy, happy!!!!  The food was delicious. The prices were reasonable and the service was really good. I highly recommend it.
author: Los D.

description: The food here is excellent. Good service from the waitress. Good sized portions.  We had the Lomo saltado, arroz con mariscos, arroz con pollo, and anticucho. All the dishes were delicious.  I think the food here is as good as the food at Fresca, but at much lower prices. The interior of the restaurant is not fancy, but looks clean. Parking is difficult and the neighborhood is a little sketchy. Will return soon to try more dishes.
author: Chester L.

description: Muy buena comida peruana! Portions are big unlike fresca, la mar and limon. Food is fresh and tasty. Chicha and pisco excellent as well.
author: Serge C.

description: The best food we have eaten in San Francisco- and we have spent way more money on other meals! We ordered the rice bowl- it was perfectly spiced as a Peruvian-Asian fusion. So good!
author: Linda N.

description: Sonia was our server. I had the seafood mariscos. I wasn't sure what to expect at first but, I was pleasantly surprised with this Cioppino tasting delight. The seafood was hearty.thank you.
author: Michael W.

description: Succulent food and fantastic service! This is gourmet Peruvian at it's best. They also have delicious beverages. The Owner is just beautiful in terms of interaction and attention to detail. The hospitality is great! The decorum is seriously understated given the quality of the experience. My Partner and I have been there 3 times now and consistent every time. We'll be back dozens more!
author: Andrew N.
